data.title: Average pizza, thin crust and very very fast
data.text:
Standard pizza parlor.
Pleasent staff.
Reasonably priced with most pizzas around $7.95

Quick service and pizza made to order.
Less than 5 minutes from order to it's ready!

Thin crust...it's good
Sauce is red and thick...not so good.
Right amount of cheese and toppings.
Average pizza

data.title: Went for great pizza. Stayed for salads.
data.text:
The four in my family went here last night for pizza. My son ordered the cheese pizza and me, my wife, and daughter had the made-to-order salads. A lot of veggies to choose from and plenty of options on the greens.

 At $7.95 a salad it was the absolute best deal in town and scrumptious salad. Well presented and service was great.:)

data.title: Good pizza
data.text: I actually went to the store on California Ave for a late lunch. Just one other table there. I had the regular Boss Special.It was good. I love the thin, cracker like crust. The only things I didn't like was it seemed like the pizza needed to cook a little more and I don't like the sauce over the cheese. The onions needed to cook a little more. I got a couple bites of raw onions. To me, the cheese needs to be hot and bubbly. Small issues, still a good pizza. Sauce was a little more spicy than normal pizza sauce.Good job Tak.

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: Individually made and fired pizzas! Loved them! We tried 3 different kinds and shared. They were all excellent! Can have their specialty pizzas or build your own.

data.title: good pizza i recommende
data.text: good pizza i recommende ! it is not very expensive. good welcoming, they were warm. It is near by the motel.

data.title: Great pizza!
data.text: This place is amazing for pizza lovers who like a variety of toppings. The pizzas are made to order right in front of you. Great place for a family or for a date.

data.title: Dinner with family
data.text: We had dinner with the family on the night my middle daughter got married. I love the fact each of us could get the kind of pizza we wanted. The size, price and the crust was perfect! We would definitely go back.

data.title: Good Pizza
data.text: This place had really good pizza for a good price.  The service was good.  I wish there was one closer to my house.  I will definitely eat there again when I am in the downtown area.

data.title: Always spot on
data.text: They are consistent with they're pizza. The toppings are always fresh and your food will never come out cold which is a big plus. The staff there are all super friendly and helpful and are extremely honest and knowledgeable about their menu options. The cater to a multitude of dietary options as well. Definitely a must go

data.title: Gluten Free Pizza Heaven
data.text:
After the first bite of a freshly baked Boss Pizza, my Italian-American husband said, "This is the real thing- thin crust just like the old days." I was thrilled to finally eat my very own tasty pizza since my doctor advised me to avoid gluten over ten years ago.

Slabs of fresh mozzarella and chopped fresh basil were heaped on a sweet, chunky tomato sauce. The sauce seemed a touch too sweet, but shakers of red pepper flakes and parmesan cheese on the table lent the perfect remedy. My husband and son each chose the Aloha, and they ate every single speck of their generous individual pizzas.

The staff was efficient and very friendly. We enjoyed watching them squish fat spheres of fresh pizza dough into thin crusts using some kind of high-tech device. That gave my husband an opportunity to tell stories of his father's Italian pals who artfully twirled pizza dough high into the air, using the backs of their hands to catch it so their fingers would not tear the thin dough.

Freshly baked chocolate chip cookies were the only dessert left in the case by the time we arrived for our dinner, and I am told they were delicious. They certainly smelled homemade.

It was a pleasure to eat at Boss Pizza. Supporting local business is nothing short of a civic duty in my book, so it was especially nice to see four police officers enjoying their evening meal at this establishment, too. You know the food must be good.

We wish the business owners continued success, as well as the development of the historically fascinating downtown Bakersfield community.

data.title: Great place, open till late, Pizzas are good
data.text: If you like oven baked pizzas from MOD, Pieology etc, you will also like this place. We stumbled by this place while looking up places to eat late at night. The service is quick and pizza taste good.

data.title: Gluten free crusted pizza
data.text: This place has a gluten free crust option with your choice of options. Great tasting, but be warned the kitchen is not separated, so cross contamination is very possible. The employees do try accommodate and are very friendly.

data.title: Best pizza ever
data.text: Had the best pizza ever here. Gluten free thin crust base and lots of veggie and vegan choices and made fresh.

data.title: Fast, Fresh & Friendly!
data.text: We frequent this place at least once a week! It is usually our go-to Friday night spot with the kids. They make individual size pizza right before your eyes with fresh toppings. They offer gluten free crust & dairy free cheese. The pizza is baked in an open oven within 7-8 minutes. Can't go wrong with this place!

data.title: Nice GF options
data.text: As a gluten free family of 6, we don't get much pizza unless we make it at home. While visiting family in Bakersfield, we found this place offered GF crust and individual pizzas. Everyone was able to eat without worry and get what they wanted on their own pizza! Tasted great too!

data.title: BEST PIZZA IN TOWN!!!
data.text: This place is fast and efficient and amazingly delicious! Don't let the long line during lunch time scare you away, the line moves way faster then you would expect. I got the Westchester pizza and it was literally, AMAZING! Bravo, Boss Pizza!

data.title: Thin crispy crust,  custom tastiness, VERY fast.
data.text:
Went to Boss pizza on Friday at about 11:15, to meet friends at 11:30 (wanted to save one of the large tables for the 6 of us). Since it was not yet busy, I was able to ask questions of the staff regarding the options, getting clarification on some of the available items, and such. When you come into Boss, you go to the counter  and place your order. (well, join a fast-moving line  -Boss Pizza gets really busy at lunchtime.)   I ordered the #8.  My dining companions filtered in as they came from different workplaces and ordered.  Finally all 5 had arrived and ordered, but  the noise level had ramped up so much  we had to listen very carefully for our order numbers.  One by one, the numbers got called.  except for Jeff.  his number didn't come up.  so - he went to ask about it.  they admitted it must have been overlooked somehow, so they refunded his money, and started a pizza for him.  Still - super fast. 
I never used to be a fan of thin-crust pizza, but it turns out a very thin, very crispy crust is a good transport mechanism for all the toppings, and also makes you feel like maybe you're saving quite a few calories on the crust alone, so you can say you ate a whole pizza without too much.
Boss Pizza could use a better notification system, or some noise-dampening  effects in the dining area.

data.title: Imagine if Subway made pizzas...
data.text: That's the idea here. Premade pizza dough waiting to be piled high with toppings from a bunch of protein and vegetable options. Your pizza is thrown into a superhot oven for about 2 minutes and BAM! ready to eat. They also have premade recipes for some great flavors. I go with the half carnivore (all meat) and half jalapeno popper and YES it tastes just like a jalapeno popper. For 8 bucks with a drink, you can't beat it but watch out for lunch... its usually pretty busy

data.title: Build Your Own Pizza and Salad
data.text: At first I was skeptical about going to a Subway-style build your own pizza place but after visiting Boss Pizza I was completely blown away.  Not only are the ingredients plentiful and fresh but the pizza is ready in minutes!  The staff is very attentive and even remembers what you like to order.  The salads are great, too.  I have referred many of my friends here and they always rave about it, too.

data.title: Pleasant surprise
data.text:
We decided at the last minute to have lunch at the Boss Pizza Company.  We arrived around 11:30 and the seating was starting to fill up.  The line to order, which is single file to  a choke point to place your order.  After you place your order you site down and your number is called.  The pizza options are varied and diverse.  The Boss is noted for personal size pizza for around $8 you can have a quick lunch.  It took about 15 to 17 minutes to receive our pizza.  Since we where a ground of 12 we got our food at different times.  As the noon hour approached the seating area filled up fast and many had to eat outside in the overflow are or take it to go.  

The flavor of the pizza was good and presented on  a metal pan with paper liner.  The crust is thing and crispy with good flavor.  My wife and I shared a Canadian bacon and pineapple.  It was tasty.  I had  a salad that was fantastic.  It was with fresh greens, nuts, accent vegetables and fruit.  The fruit was not as fresh as I would have hoped but very eatable.  The salad was a hit, the pizza was good to very good.  I would go again.  Do not be disappointed if you have to wait for seating.  They are busy and well patronized.
